intro: Narduretia cynosuroides, commonly known as the golden star grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its tufted growth habit and produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in a spikelet structure. The plant is native to southern Africa and thrives in sandy or rocky soils. It is often found in open grasslands and coastal areas, where it contributes to the local biodiversity. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
